subject: Education
subcategory: Literacy and the Power of Reading
title: AI and Reading: Will Machines Replace Readers?
description: A quick, practical guide to AI and Reading: Will Machines Replace Readers?.

hook.text: GPT can summarize a 500-page book in 30 seconds. If AI reads for us, do we still need to read ourselves?

buildup.text: AI summaries capture facts but miss nuance, emotion, and the cognitive benefits of processing text yourself.

discovery.text: Reading isn't just about information extraction. It builds neural pathways, empathy, critical thinking, and attention

twist.text: Outsourcing reading to AI is like outsourcing exercise to a robot. The point isn't the output â€” it's what the process

climax.text: AI can tell you what a book says. Only reading can change how you think. The process is the product.

punchline.text: AI can read a book in seconds. But only you can be changed by reading it.

quiz.question: Why can't AI summaries fully replace the act of reading?
options: Reading itself builds cognitive skills like empathy and critical thinking that summaries skip
